title: Introduction and prerequisites
description: In this article, we draw the plan and start the project. We will create a Jekyll website and create a VSTS project with a Git repository.

title: Part 1: The VSTS Build
description: In this article, we create the Jekyll build definition in VSTS.

title: Part 2: Create Azure Blob Storage, and configure static website
description: In this article, we create an Azure Blob Storage and we configure it to be ready for the deployment phase.

title: Part 3: The VSTS Release
description: In this article, we create the release definition. At the end, every code push in `master` will be deployed automatically.

title: Part 4: Configuring a Content Delivery Network (CDN)
description: In this article, we create the final piece of the puzzle, the way to access our Jekyll website using a custom domain over HTTPS. We also update the VSTS CD pipeline to account for this new addition.

title: Infrastructure as code
description: In this article, I give you the VSTS pipeline code that you can import.

title: Conclusion
description: This is the end, a little recap of what was achieved.
